discussion.p:
basic_string_view::copy is inconsistent with basic_string::copy, in that the former uses copy_n and the latter uses traits::copy. We should have this handling be consistent.
Moreover, the basic_string::copy description is excessively roundabout due to copy-on-write era wording.
Removed "Note to project editor", since the issue there has been fixed in the current draft.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4606.

blockquote.pre: size_type copy(charT* s, size_type n, size_type pos = 0) const;

p.ins: -?- Let rlen be the smaller of n and size() - pos.
-?- Requires: [s, s + rlen) is a valid range.

li.p: -3- Effects: Determines the effective length rlen of the string to copy as the smaller of n and size() - pos. s shall designate an array of at least rlen elements.Equivalent to: traits::copy(s, data() + pos, rlen). [Note: This does not terminate s with a null object. — end note]

p.del: The function then replaces the string designated by s with a string of length rlen whose elements are a copy of the string controlled by *this beginning at position pos.
The function does not append a null object to the string designated by s.

blockquote.pre: size_type copy(charT* s, size_type n, size_type pos = 0) const;

li.p: -1- Let rlen be the smaller of n and size() - pos.
-3- Requires: [s, s + rlen) is a valid range.
-4- Effects: Equivalent to: copy_n(begin() + pos, rlen, s)traits::copy(s, data() + pos, rlen)
